ai.summary: An 8.9 km urban heritage walk in the United Kingdom tracing streets associated with the Jack the Ripper lore. The route is of moderate difficulty and offers historical context along city sidewalks.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily paved urban streets with occasional cobbles; mostly flat with some gentle inclines and frequent curb crossings.
ai.safety_notes: Urban environment: follow pedestrian rules, stay on well-lit streets if walking in the evening, keep valuables secure, and be aware of traffic at crossings. The route passes through busy areas; consider starting in daylight. For solo walkers, share your plan with someone and carry a phone with emergency numbers. Weather can change; bring rain gear.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing (layers; rain jacket if rain is likely)

seo.meta_description: Experience an 8.9 km urban heritage walk in the UK inspired by the Jack the Ripper era. Moderate difficulty, historical context, and city views.
